translation.en: Oh, my God. Where is it?
Yamada- san, do you have the newspaper?
BODY PART FOUND IN TOKYO BAY
translation.es: HALLAN UN CUERPO EN LA BAHÍA DE TOKIO

translation.en: They're saying it could be Lily.
He asked me to give it to you.
translation.es: Me pidió que te lo diera.

translation.en: - Anything else? - What are you busting my ass for?
'Cause you could get me killed, Detective.
It's on my alien registration card.
translation.es: Está en mi tarjeta de residencia de extranjera.

translation.en: - Why was I not told she's a translator? - Sorry, I didn't know.
translation.es: ¿Cómo no me dijeron? Lo siento, no sabía.

translation.en: - I didn’t know she was such a smart ass. - Be careful.
I want you to tell me about the night Lily Bridges disappeared.
translation.es: Háblenos sobre la noche que desapareció Lily Bridges.

translation.en: From what we can tell, you were the last person she spoke to.
translation.es: Por lo que sabemos, usted fue la última persona que la vio.

translation.en: We spoke for a minute or so.

translation.es: Así que regresé a mi casa.
Su vecino nos dijo otra cosa.

translation.en: She said a few minutes later, you left your apartment without an umbrella.
translation.es: Dijo que minutos después, usted salió de su apartamento sin paraguas.

translation.en: So, it wasn't the last time that you saw her?
translation.es: ¿Entonces esa no fue la última vez que la vio?

translation.en: - I didn't catch up with her. - Why did you follow her?
translation.es: - No la encontré. - ¿Por qué la siguió?

translation.en: She had something of mine. I wanted it back.
translation.es: Tenía algo mío. Lo quería de vuelta.

translation.en: So you spoke to her again?
No. I said I didn't find her.
translation.es: No. Le dije que no la encontré.

translation.en: You assumed she was going to the station?
translation.es: ¿Usted asumió que iba a la estación?

translation.en: - Is that strange? - And you never saw her again?
translation.es: - ¿Eso está mal? - ¿Y nunca la volvió a ver?

translation.en: How many times do I need to answer the same question?
tell me, how long have you been in Japan?
- You are unmarried, of course. - Of course.
- Do you have a boyfriend? - No.
What do you take pictures of then?
But everyone calls me Lucy Fly.
What kind of camera is that?

translation.es: Con un lente Zuiko de 50 mm.

translation.en: Because that's what normal people do.
- But you are not normal. - Neither are you.
So let's not pretend to be.
Let's just be honest with each other from the beginning.
All day long, I watch people talk,
saying all kinds of things without saying what they are really thinking.
translation.es: y decir todo tipo de cosas, sin decir realmente lo que piensan.

translation.en: Well, the noodles are too hot, and the broth is too salty.
translation.es: Los fideos están muy calientes y el caldo está muy salado.

translation.en: This is the strangest date I've ever been on, if it's even a date.
translation.es: Esta es la cita más extraña que tuve, si es que es una cita.

translation.en: I probably shouldn't trust a stranger that I've just met,
translation.es: No debería confiar en un extraño que acabo de conocer,

translation.en: Now, you be honest with me.
You've already done that. What else?
Yes. Not many people have been here.
translation.es: Sí. No ha venido mucha gente.

translation.en: Where do you want me to stand?
What do you want me to do?
I've never had my picture taken before.
Yeah, I do. What is it?
A friend of mine is organizing a special event
translation.es: Un amigo está organizando el Festival de Tanabata

translation.en: for the Tanabata Festival and asked us to perform.
translation.es: Un amigo está organizando el Festival de Tanabata y nos pidió que tocáramos.

translation.en: But that only gives us two months.
Maybe if we could practice twice a week, we could do it.
translation.es: Si practicáramos dos veces por semana, podríamos hacerlo.

translation.en: I brought you a gift for your birthday.
translation.es: Te traje un regalo por tu cumpleaños.

translation.en: I have many at home. I cultivate them myself.
translation.es: Tengo muchos en casa. Los cultivo yo misma.

translation.en: I don't normally give them away.
translation.es: Por lo general no los regalo.

translation.en: - Thanks. I do my best. - Yeah?
Come and meet the new recruit.
translation.es: Ven a conocer a la nueva recluta.

translation.en: So, she can't seem to get her bearings here. She feels like she's landed on the moon or something.
translation.es: Todavía no se halla, siente que aterrizó en la luna.

translation.en: So, anything you can do to help her would be great.
translation.es: Sería genial si la puedes ayudar.

translation.en: Lucy, this is Lily. Lily, Lucy Fly.
translation.es: Lucy, ella es Lily.  Lily, Lucy Fly.

translation.en: - Thank you, Natsuko. - It's your birthday?
translation.es: Gracias, Natsuko. ¿Es tu cumpleaños? Gracias por invitarme a tu fiesta.

translation.en: Thanks for inviting me to your birthday party.
translation.es: ¿Es tu cumpleaños? Gracias por invitarme a tu fiesta.

translation.en: Well, it's not really that, but you're welcome.
translation.es: Bueno, no es tan así, pero de nada.

translation.en: Uh, drinks for the birthday girl. We have champagne.
translation.es: Brindemos por la cumpleañera. Tenemos champaña.

translation.en: - I'll have Sapporo, please. - Oh, me too.
- Okay. - I'll give you a hand.
Um, so, how long have you been in Japan?
I mean, it's been, like, totally crazy. Like, everything is so different.
translation.es: Ha sido una locura. Es todo tan diferente.

translation.en: - Yeah, I guess that's why we're all here. - Oh, I hear you.
translation.es: - Sí, creo que por eso estamos todos aquí. - Entiendo.

translation.en: I'd had it with DC. I had to get out.
translation.es: Me cansé de DC. Tenía que irme.

translation.en: But that was a long time ago. So I kind of see myself from here now.
translation.es: Pero eso fue hace mucho tiempo. Ahora ya me siento de aquí.

translation.en: Bob said you were looking for somewhere to live.
translation.es: Bob dijo que buscabas un lugar para vivir.

translation.en: Yeah, I really need to find somewhere.
I've been so stressed out about it that I've been breaking out in hives.
translation.es: Me estresé tanto que tengo urticaria.

translation.en: But I'm working at a bar right now, and my dad sent me money, so I can afford my own place.
translation.es: Estoy trabajando en un bar, y mi papá me ayudará a pagar un alquiler.

translation.en: But it's hard to find anywhere, especially if you don't speak the language.
translation.es: Pero es difícil encontrar un lugar sin hablar el idioma.

translation.en: I heard you speak good Japanese.
translation.es: Oí que hablas muy bien japonés.

translation.en: Oh, you're lucky, though. I wish I could.
I'm going to kill you, Bob.
We don't have anything in common.
I don't wanna get stuck looking after her.
Oh, you won't. It's just... Look, she's new, so I--
translation.es: No lo harás. Es solo, es nueva, así que...

translation.en: Tokyo has tons of newcomers. If I took care of all of them,
translation.es: Tokio recibe muchos inmigrantes. Si cuidara a todos,

translation.en: I wouldn't have a life of my own.
All right. I'm sorry I opened my big mouth.
So, how's it going with the guy you met?
translation.es: ¿Cómo te va con el chico que conociste?

translation.en: Does he have a soy sauce face or a ketchup face?
translation.es: ¿Tiene cara de salsa de soja o de kétchup?

translation.en: That's the way we talk about whether a Japanese person looks Eastern or Western.
translation.es: Así decimos para saber si un japonés parece oriental u occidental.

translation.en: - What do you mean? - You know?
- In the bedroom? - We haven't done anything yet.
translation.es: - ¿En la cama? - Aún no hicimos nada.

translation.en: - Taking it slow? - It's not up to me.
I didn't ask you to do that.
translation.es: No te pedí que lo hicieras.

translation.en: It's a furisode. They’re worn on happy occasions.
translation.es: Es un furisode. Se usa en ocasiones felices.

translation.en: It’s not so easy for single women in Japan.
translation.es: No es fácil para las solteras en Japón.

translation.en: Have you ever thought of getting married?
Because of my job. You know, I'm a magistrate.
translation.es: Por mi trabajo. Soy jueza, ya sabes.

translation.en: It’s a little intimidating for most men.
translation.es: Es algo intimidante para la mayoría de los hombres.

translation.en: And besides, I’m too old now.
Not in the eyes of Japanese men.
Maybe I could get a widower.
Or an old one with medical problems.
translation.es: O un anciano con problemas médicos.

translation.en: But I don’t know how I'd find the time.
I have my job, my friends, the string quartet.
translation.es: Tengo mi trabajo, mis amigas, el cuarteto de cuerdas.

translation.en: It’s a lot to give up to wash some old man’s diapers.
translation.es: Renunciaría a mucho para cambiarle los pañales a un anciano.

translation.en: - That must be Yamamoto- san. - Hm.
I’ll go and help her with the cakes.
translation.es: Iré a ayudarla con los pasteles.

translation.en: She fell down the stairs when I greeted her.
translation.es: Se cayó de la escalera cuando la saludé.

translation.en: Death follows me. It always has.
translation.es: La muerte me sigue. Siempre lo ha hecho.

translation.en: You don't understand half of it.
You will tell me, in time.
translation.es: Con el tiempo, me lo contarás.

translation.en: And I will tell you things about me.
translation.es: Y yo te contaré cosas sobre mí.

translation.en: The first time we saw each other,
translation.es: La primera vez que nos vimos,

translation.en: I knew we could be truthful.
My aunt, she brought me up.
After she died, I left Kagoshima and came to Tokyo.
translation.es: Cuando murió, me fui de Kagoshima y vine a Tokio.

translation.en: We live in the atmosphere of death.
Do you know someone called Teiji Matsuda?
When did you first meet him?
You seem very certain of that.
Why didn't you say that when I asked before?
He asked in the wrong tense.
This is a murder investigation. You understand?
And we strongly suspect it was someone who knew her.
translation.es: Sospechamos que fue alguien que la conocía.

translation.en: This is a very serious matter.
You are not like Japanese women.
I don't understand how anyone finds anything
translation.es: No entiendo cómo encuentran las calles

translation.en: if none of the streets have names.
I guess I'm just gonna have to learn numbers.
Oh, I love this one! It's so Japanese.
I think I had a dream about a place like this, but in my dream it was a tree house.
translation.es: Creo que soñé con este lugar, pero en mi sueño era una casa del árbol.

translation.en: - The kitchen’s small. - I don't cook.
translation.es: - La cocina es pequeña. - No cocino.

translation.en: Well, I guess the only real downside is that it's an old building,
translation.es: Creo que la única contra es que es un edificio viejo,

translation.en: so in case of an earthquake...
I don't care. I mean, it's lasted this long.
translation.es: No me importa. Duró todo este tiempo.

translation.en: Will you tell her for me?
It's weird how everyone stares at you in Japan.
translation.es: Es extraño cómo todos te miran en Japón.

translation.en: Yes. Some people get addicted to that.
He's kind of sexy, though, isn't he?
I don't see him that way. Nope.
translation.es: Yo no lo veo de esa manera. No.

translation.en: I can ask one of the lawyers at Sasagawa to double- check it.
translation.es: Puedo pedirle al abogado de Sasagawa que lo revise.

translation.en: Thanks. I'm so impressed you can even read that.
I can take your order if you're ready.
Will you order me a coffee?
You have to be able to order for yourself.
translation.es: Tienes que aprender a pedirlo tú misma.

translation.en: How are you gonna survive if you can't ask for anything?
translation.es: ¿Cómo vas a sobrevivir si no sabes pedir nada?

translation.en: If you want a coffee, you say, Koohii o hitotsu,
translation.es: Si quieres un café, dices: Koohii o hitotsu,

translation.en: which means one, kudasai, which means please.
translation.es: y luego kudasai, que significa por favor.

translation.en: That's crazy that she understood that.
The light, the shadow, everything exactly right.
translation.es: La luz, la sombra, es perfecta.

translation.en: I was always in the darkroom.
There was an old teacher, Mr. Hyakutake, who taught me.
translation.es: Un viejo maestro, el señor Hyakutake, me enseñó.

translation.en: There were about a dozen people in the photography club,
but eventually, they all left, and there was only me.
translation.es: pero todos abandonaron y quedé solo.

translation.en: I read once that when... the Westerners arrived in 19th century Japan,
translation.es: Una vez leí que cuando los occidentales llegaron a Japón en el siglo XIX

translation.en: they wanted to photograph the locals, but...
translation.es: querían fotografiar a los lugareños, pero...

translation.en: They thought it would steal their soul.
translation.es: Creían que les robaba el alma.

translation.en: The subject always gives something, some part of themselves, to the photographer.
translation.es: El sujeto siempre da algo, una parte de sí mismo, al fotógrafo.

translation.en: If every time I took a photo it took a piece of your soul...
translation.es: Si cada vez que te tomara una foto, me llevara un pedazo de tu alma...

translation.en: I think you know the answer to that question.
translation.es: Creo que ya sabes la respuesta.

translation.en: What else do you have in there?
Didn't Teiji wanna come today? I've gotta meet him one of these days.
translation.es: ¿Teiji no quiso venir? Quisiera conocerlo algún día.

translation.en: - You will. - You two getting on well?
Well, I guess we're both a bit odd, but we fit well together.
translation.es: Supongo que ambos somos un poco raros, pero nos llevamos bien.

translation.en: Oh, so the band's playing another gig next week. At the Downbeat Club in Ikebukuro.
translation.es: La banda tocará la semana próxima en el Downbeat en Ikebukuro.

translation.en: Yeah, these musicians, they are the best I've ever played with.
translation.es: Estos músicos son los mejores que conozco.

translation.en: I used to have a couple of bands back in England,
but, you know, there's so much negativity there.
I think that's what I like most about Japan.
translation.es: Es lo que más me gusta de Japón.

translation.en: It gives you a second chance.
Oh, my goodness. Look at that.
- Did anyone bring a camera? - Not me.
- What about... good morning? - Ohayo gozaimasu.
Uh... And then if you meet someone for the first time, you just say,
translation.es: Y si conoces a alguien por primera vez, dices:

translation.en: No, no, I'm-- - Sit down. - Ah!
- I'm gonna take your shoe off. - What?
I fell on this, and Lily's playing nurse.
translation.es: Me caí y Lily hace de enfermera.

translation.en: I'm not playing. I used to work at George Washington Hospital. I am a nurse.
translation.es: No estoy jugando. Fui enfermera del hospital Washington.

translation.en: Yeah, I wasn't always a bartender.
- Why don't you come in here? - I'm going to go in with Lucy.
translation.es: - ¿Por qué no vienes aquí? - Iré con Lucy.

translation.en: You think Teiji would like it here?

translation.es: y los reflejos. Estaría fotografiando todo.

translation.en: I love taking photographs, but I'm not very good.
translation.es: Me encanta tomar fotos, pero no soy buena.

translation.en: - Does he sell his pictures? - I don't think so.
Well, what does he do with them?
I wish I could meet him.
Why don't you and I go down to the noodle shop one night?
translation.es: ¿Por qué no vamos al restaurante una noche?

translation.en: - I don't know. - Come on, it'll be fun.
why don't you do something with your photographs?
translation.es: ...¿por qué no haces algo con tus fotografías?

translation.en: I mean, not the ones of me, of course, but...
translation.es: No hablo de las mías, claro, sino...

translation.en: the ones of the city. They're really good.
translation.es: ...de las de la ciudad. Son muy buenas.

translation.en: - why are you taking them? - I'm collecting them.
Or put them in a book, let people see them.
translation.es: O ponerlas en un libro, para que las vean.

translation.en: Why does it matter to you so much?
I've got to go to work.
Will I see you this weekend?
- Um... Yes, but... - I will call you.
Yes. I must get back to work.
We finished. She left. I didn’t try to find her.
translation.es: Terminamos. Se fue. No la busqué.

translation.en: When I found you, I stopped thinking of Sachi.
translation.es: Cuando te encontré, dejé de pensar en Sachi.

translation.en: I'm sorry. Please forget I ever did this.
translation.es: Lo siento. Por favor, olvida que hice esto.

translation.en: - I have to get back. - Hold me.
It's just that I think about you all the time, every moment.
translation.es: Pienso en ti todo el tiempo, en cada momento.

translation.en: - I wanted to know more about you. - That's not the way to find out.
translation.es: - Quería saber más de ti. - Esa no es la manera.

translation.en: I just got a letter from my mom, and it took eight days to get here.
translation.es: Recibí una carta de mi mamá y tardó ocho días en llegar.

translation.en: I called my girlfriend and we talked for, like, 20 minutes. And it cost over a hundred bucks.
translation.es: Llamé a una amiga, hablamos 20 minutos, y me costó más de cien dólares.

translation.en: I find it better not to call.
It's getting late. I think Lily wants to go home.
translation.es: Ya es tarde. Creo que Lily quiere irse a su casa.

translation.en: Are you kidding? I'd love to.
Oh, my God. He's so cute!
He's not cute. Kittens are cute.
translation.es: No es lindo. Los gatitos son lindos.

translation.en: Okay, whatever, he's gorgeous. And he's so tall.
translation.es: Como sea, es precioso. Y es muy alto.

translation.en: I thought Japanese guys were supposed to be short.
translation.es: Creí que los japoneses eran bajitos.

translation.en: That's bullshit. That's just a stereotype.
translation.es: Eso es mentira. Es solo un estereotipo.

translation.en: Hey! I was just in the area.
- Hey! - I don't wanna bother you if Teiji's here.
translation.es: - Hola. - No quiero molestar si estás con Teiji.

translation.en: - He doesn't come here. - I brought whiskey.
It's so much nicer than mine.
translation.es: Es mucho más linda que la mía.

translation.en: - No tree, though. - No, no tree.
translation.es: - Pero sin árbol. - No, ningún árbol.

translation.en: You don't have any pictures of Teiji anywhere.
translation.es: No tienes fotos de Teiji en ningún lado.

translation.en: He doesn't like having his picture taken.
translation.es: No le gusta que le saquen fotos.

translation.en: It was really great meeting him the other night.
translation.es: Me gustó conocerlo la otra noche.

translation.en: - Why do you say that? - 'Cause I can tell. I know men.
translation.es: - ¿Por qué lo dices? - Me doy cuenta. Sé de hombres.

translation.en: I don't believe in all of that.
translation.es: No creo en nada de eso.

translation.en: My personality is a combination of my genes,
translation.es: Mi personalidad es una combinación de mis genes,

translation.en: my upbringing, my parents, my school. Nothing to do with the stars.
translation.es: mi educación, mis padres, mi escuela. Nada que ver con las estrellas.

translation.en: Yeah, but I can also just tell.
Sometimes, at the bar, I have to be careful when I'm getting people's change
translation.es: En el bar, intento no mirar las manos

translation.en: not to look at their hands 'cause I see things.
translation.es: cuando me dan cambio, porque veo cosas.

translation.en: In the past, there's like a...
And then you have these three breaks in the line.
translation.es: Y tienes estas tres marcas en la línea.

translation.en: There's one early on, then another, and then a third.
translation.es: Hay una más antigua, luego otra, y una tercera.

translation.en: What do you see about the future?
It's really complicated. I can't read it.
Well, it's like a window that opens up and then I can see things.
translation.es: Es como una ventana que se abre y veo cosas.

translation.en: And then it fogs up and then I can't really be sure of anything.
translation.es: Luego se empaña y ya no puedo estar segura de nada.

translation.en: - I didn't mean to freak you out. - I'm not freaked out.
translation.es: - No quería asustarte. - No lo estoy.

translation.en: - I think it stopped. - Yeah, I think it did.
translation.es: - Creo que se detuvo. - Sí, eso creo.
Se escucha después de un terremoto.

translation.en: Just trying to wake myself up.
I had a great night's sleep.
Couldn't have been a big one. I must've slept through it.
translation.es: Debe haber sido pequeño. No me desperté.

translation.en: It looks like it's going to rain. Can I borrow a coat?
translation.es: Creo que lloverá. ¿Me prestas un abrigo?

translation.en: I was wondering, do you want to go to Sado Island with me?
translation.es: ¿Te gustaría acompañarme a la isla de Sado?

translation.en: Katoh- san, my friend, she's in the string quartet.
translation.es: Katoh-san, mi amiga, está en el cuarteto de cuerdas.

translation.en: She's from there, and she says it's like time traveling into the past.
translation.es: Ella es de allí y dice que es como viajar al pasado.

translation.en: It's an arts and culture festival--
translation.es: Es un festival de arte y cultura...

translation.en: Won't you be going with Teiji?
If he can get off work, yes.
translation.es: Si puede salir del trabajo, sí.

translation.en: I have to think about it, because Bob invited me to some concert that he's--
translation.es: Lo pensaré, porque Bob me invitó a este concierto que...

translation.en: Thank you. I'll take care of it.
let's not take any more photos today.
- Okay. - No, I mean, we could take some more.
translation.es: - De acuerdo. - Bueno, podríamos tomar más.

translation.en: Not when you don't want to.
Did you used to go out in Shinjuku with Sachi?
Natsuko, the girl I work with, she has a sister who's in a band,
translation.es: Natsuko, con quien trabajo, tiene una hermana en una banda

translation.en: and they're gonna play at this club tomorrow night.
translation.es: y tocará en un bar mañana.

translation.en: Well, we never go out. We could.
Bob is gonna be there, and... Lily, I think.
translation.es: Bob estará ahí y, Lily, creo.

translation.en: - What do you think? - About what?
I don't get it. They're not really my thing.
translation.es: No la entiendo. No es mi estilo.

translation.en: I mean, they have an image.
Apparently, they just signed a record contract.
translation.es: Acaban de firmar un contrato discográfico.

translation.en: So, are you and Lily dating now?
Nope. She's a piece of work, that one.
She sends all these signals, but she doesn't follow through.
All right, so... we got off together.
translation.es: Por ejemplo, nos besamos una vez.

translation.en: And fair enough, it was just once,
translation.es: Fue solo esa vez, pero luego planeamos ir a un festival

translation.en: but then we made a plan to go to this music festival in Nagoya this weekend.
translation.es: Fue solo esa vez, pero luego planeamos ir a un festival el fin de semana.

translation.en: And she just called and canceled and didn't give me any reason.
translation.es: Y luego me canceló sin ninguna explicación.

translation.en: When she's interested in you, you're the only one who exists.
translation.es: Si le interesas, eres lo único que existe.

translation.en: Then she moves on to someone else, and it's like you were never even there.
translation.es: Luego conoce a otro, y es como si no existieras.

translation.en: - Do you want a beer? - I'll get one, mate.
- Did you have fun tonight? - Yeah.
Well, you and Lily were having a good time out there.
translation.es: Bueno, tú y Lily la estaban pasando bien.

translation.en: Yes. She is a good dancer.
You are my girlfriend, after all.
translation.es: Eres mi novia, después de todo.

translation.en: How many girlfriends did you have before Sachi?
You were too busy in the school darkroom?
translation.es: ¿Estabas muy ocupado en el cuarto oscuro de la escuela?

translation.en: When did you lose your virginity?
I didn’t really like the girls in my hometown.
translation.es: No me gustaban las chicas de mi pueblo.

translation.en: How about you? Your first time?

translation.es: La ocasión no fue muy romántica.

translation.en: I went over to see my friend at her house, but...
translation.es: Fui a visitar a mi amiga a su casa, pero...
Estaba en su clase de netball.

translation.en: Her dad told me that he had his own
translation.es: Su papá me dijo que tenía su propia

translation.en: vodka distillery in the garden shed, so we went and...
translation.es: destilería de vodka en el cobertizo del jardín, así que fui...
Después de eso estuve con náuseas.

translation.en: too happy, of course, when I told him.
translation.es: ...muy feliz, claro, cuando se lo conté.

translation.en: And my friend didn't show up to school.
translation.es: Y mi amiga no volvió a la escuela.

translation.en: It turns out that he had gone off to sea in a canoe and went too far out.
translation.es: Resulta que él se metió al mar en una canoa y se alejó demasiado.

translation.en: The current was too strong, they said.
translation.es: La corriente se lo llevó, dijeron.

translation.en: He washed up a few kilometers down the shore.
translation.es: Apareció a unos kilómetros de la costa.

translation.en: And I found out that the baby...
Do you still think about him?
It's an old book, but has a lot about the culture of Sado.
translation.es: Es un libro viejo, pero tiene mucho sobre la cultura de Sado.

translation.en: but not so many people go there anymore.
translation.es: pero ya no mucha gente la visita.

translation.en: - You seem a little-- - I'm perfectly fine.
translation.es: - Pareces un poco... - Estoy muy bien.

translation.en: - I have some cream you can use. - No. I'm good.
translation.es: - Tengo una crema si quieres. - No, gracias.

translation.en: I haven't seen him since Tuesday when we went to the club.
translation.es: No lo veo desde el martes cuando fuimos al bar.

translation.en: No. He's just been very busy lately,
translation.es: No. Últimamente ha estado muy ocupado,

translation.en: and I've been working on those translations for electrical--
translation.es: y yo estuve trabajando en unas traducciones - de electricidad... - Ahí está.

translation.en: - I never thought you'd come. - Why not?
- Well, it's good to see you. - You too.
translation.es: - Me alegra verte. - A mí también.

translation.en: It's probably very cold and full of sea urchins and...
translation.es: Debe estar muy frío y lleno de erizos de mar y...

translation.en: So, Lily, you're a nurse in America.
translation.es: Lily, eres enfermera en Estados Unidos.

translation.en: I mean, I do miss the hospital, and the bar is really hard.
translation.es: Extraño el hospital y el bar es cansador.

translation.en: I think it's a good kind of work, like the noodle shop.
translation.es: Es un buen trabajo, como el restaurante.

translation.en: It gives me all the time I need for thinking.
Because my body just gets on with the job by itself.
translation.es: Es el cuerpo el que hace todo el trabajo.

translation.en: Yeah. I'm really bad at bartending, though.
translation.es: Sí. Pero soy muy mala camarera.

translation.en: Sometimes I think the customers are gonna start jumping over the counter and serving themselves.
translation.es: A veces creo que los clientes se irán a servirse solos.

translation.en: At least now you're not around death every day.
translation.es: Al menos ya no te rodea la muerte.

translation.en: I mean, that's part of the job.
Well, I'd say that there were three times that I saved somebody's life,
translation.es: Bueno, en tres ocasiones le salvé la vida a alguien,

translation.en: so I like to think about that rather than...
translation.es: entonces prefiero pensar en eso en lugar de...

translation.en: I just really like the color. You don't mind, do you?
Teiji can sleep here, and you can sleep here next to me.
translation.es: Teiji puede dormir aquí, y tú de este lado.

translation.en: This is a traditional Japanese breakfast.
I think I’d prefer some traditional Japanese cornflakes.
I heard about this, um, gold mine in Aikawa.
translation.es: Oí sobre esta mina de oro en Aikawa.

translation.en: It could be fun to go visit.
Apparently, they have these animatronic mannequins that kind of show how the miners used to work.
translation.es: Tienen estos maniquís animados que muestran cómo trabajaban los mineros.

translation.en: I'd kind of rather see the coast and the cliffs at Senkaku.
translation.es: Prefiero ir a los acantilados de Senkaku.

translation.en: Well, how about we go and do both?
We'll go to the cliffs in the morning, and then we'll go and cool off in the gold mine in the afternoon.
translation.es: Los acantilados a la mañana y la mina de oro por la tarde.

translation.en: I can't believe you just did that.
Hold on, sit down. Sit down. Sit down.
You're running a temperature. I'm going to lay you down, okay?
translation.es: Tienes fiebre. Te voy a recostar, ¿sí?

translation.en: I'm going to lay you down.
Just try and lay down. It's okay.
translation.es: Ahora trata de calmarte. Está bien.

translation.en: You left me on a fucking cliff top.
translation.es: Me dejaron en un maldito acantilado.

translation.en: - Did you get our note? - Note?
Yeah. We left you a note under a rock, by the shirt, saying we were coming here,
translation.es: Dejamos una nota diciendo que veníamos aquí,

translation.en: and if you didn't come here, we'd come back for you.
No, I didn't see a note just lying around.
translation.es: No, no vi ninguna nota por ahí.

translation.en: - Oh. Well, it must've blown away. - Right.
Yeah, maybe. Maybe we're all just gonna blow away off the edge of the world.
translation.es: Sí, o quizá vamos a desaparecer en algún rincón del mundo.

translation.en: You might have a virus, or it could be that fish eye you had for breakfast.
translation.es: Podrías tener un virus o quizá fue el pescado.

translation.en: I've got pills at the hotel. Why don't we go back?
translation.es: Tengo pastillas en el hotel, ¿por qué no...?

translation.en: - I don't need your pills. - I'm just trying to help.
- Lucy, you're not making any sense. - I know what I'm feeling.
translation.es: - Lucy, no tiene sentido lo que dices. - Sé lo que siento.

translation.en: And what I'm feeling isn't right. It's not right at all.
translation.es: Y lo que siento no está bien. No está nada bien.

translation.en: It's like nature is taking it back.
translation.es: Es como si la naturaleza se lo llevara.

translation.en: Tell me! How did you kill her?
It is good you are talking now.
Tell me why you did it.
It's best to give us as much information as possible.
translation.es: Cuanta más información nos des ahora, mejor será.

translation.en: All you need to know is
I'm not in right now. Please leave a message.
translation.es: Ahora no puedo atender. Por favor, deja un mensaje.

translation.en: I need to talk to you.
- Are you sick? - I'm not feeling very well.
translation.es: ¿Estás enferma? No me siento muy bien.

translation.en: I'll be fine in a day or two.
Is there something you need to talk about?
Well, what should I tell them at work?
translation.es: ¿Qué quieres que diga en el trabajo?

translation.en: You can tell them anything. I'm quitting.
Lucy, what are you talking about?
I'm worried about you. Just leave me, Natsuko!
I know I fucked up and I'm sorry.
translation.es: Sé que la cagué y lo siento.

translation.en: I don't know. Kind of. It's kind of driving me crazy, you know?
translation.es: No lo sé. Un poco. Me está volviendo loca, ¿sabes?

translation.en: I invited you to Sado Island.
translation.es: Yo te invité a la isla de Sado.

translation.en: I was the one who introduced you in the first place.
translation.es: Yo fui la que los presentó.

translation.en: I know you're angry, and this isn't an excuse,
translation.es: Sé que estás enojada, no es una excusa,

translation.en: but maybe there's a bigger reason for all of this that...
translation.es: pero quizá haya otra razón para todo esto

translation.en: - that we don't understand. - Well, did you see it in my palm?
translation.es: - que no entendamos. - ¿Lo leíste en mi mano?

translation.en: Did you dream it was meant to be?
He was the only person who ever really saw who I was!
translation.es: ¡Él es la única persona que me conoció de verdad!

translation.en: I'm sorry! But can I please come in?
I feel like something really bad is gonna happen.
translation.es: Siento que algo malo va a suceder.

translation.en: Looks like the girl in the bay
translation.es: Parece que la chica de la bahía

translation.en: was not your friend after all.
we do know it wasn't Lily Bridges.
That puts your statement in serious doubt.
translation.es: Eso pone tu declaración en serias dudas.

translation.en: Then why did you say you did?
Because I wanted to kill her.
You do realize the crime you confessed to

translation.es: es punible con la pena de muerte?

translation.en: We have been unable to locate Mr. Matsuda.
translation.es: No hemos podido localizar al señor Matsuda.

translation.en: Do you know where he is?
Do you think there’s a possibility that Lily and Matsuda may have
translation.es: ¿Crees que exista la posibilidad de que Lily y Matsuda

translation.en: At this point, we are reclassifying this as a missing persons case.
translation.es: Por ahora... ...calificaremos el caso como desaparición de persona.

translation.en: I think I may have preferred it when she was dead.
translation.es: Creo que hubiera preferido que esté muerta.

translation.en: we all live in our own reality.

translation.es: Tal vez... ...en cierta manera creíste haber matado a Lily Bridges.

translation.en: you thought you did kill Lily Bridges.
translation.es: ...en cierta manera creíste haber matado a Lily Bridges.
Pero nunca me pareció que fuera así.

translation.en: You have guilt, but it is from a deeper source.
translation.es: Tienes culpa, pero es de otra fuente más profunda.

translation.en: Why did you come to Japan?
I would take a book and read.
my brothers showed up. They had been on a fishing trip with the Boy Scouts.
translation.es: ...aparecieron mis hermanos. Habían ido a pescar con los Boy Scouts.
Habían ido a pescar con los Boy Scouts.

translation.en: and started throwing pine cones and stones...
translation.es: Rodearon el árbol y comenzaron a lanzar piñas y piedras...

translation.en: There was this sharp heavy stone on the ground.
translation.es: Había una piedra filosa en el suelo.

translation.en: Marcus, he had his hands on it.
by a long rusty nail sticking out from a plank of wood.
translation.es: ...por un clavo largo y oxidado que sobresalía de una madera.

translation.en: He tried to get up with the plank still attached to him.
translation.es: Intentó levantarse con la tabla aún clavada.

translation.en: again, his eyes stared back at me.
translation.es: ...de nuevo me miró a los ojos.

translation.en: The nurse said to me, It's not your fault.
translation.es: La enfermera me dijo: No es tu culpa.

translation.en: I didn't know what she meant.
translation.es: Yo no sabía a qué se refería.

translation.en: I didn't speak for three years.
It's easy to ignore people when they are silent.
translation.es: Es fácil ignorar a las personas cuando están calladas.

translation.en: So that's what my family did.
translation.es: Y eso fue lo que hizo mi familia.

translation.en: I knew what they were thinking about me.
translation.es: Yo sabía lo que pensaban de mí.

translation.en: At the age of 11, I started learning Japanese.
translation.es: - ¿Cómo? - A los 11, comencé a aprender japonés.

translation.en: But it has nothing to do with this case.
translation.es: Pero no tiene nada que ver con este caso.

translation.en: I'm sorry. He's not in right now.
translation.es: No, en este momento no se encuentra.

translation.en: Do you want to leave a message?
He will be here tomorrow morning.
I've been waiting for you for two days.
translation.es: Te estoy esperando hace dos días.

translation.en: I knew I had to come here, that you would understand.
translation.es: Sabía que tenía que venir, que comprenderías.

translation.en: I was at the police station.
translation.es: Fui a la estación de policía.

translation.en: We can go away from here, to the north.
translation.es: Nos podríamos ir de aquí, al norte.

translation.en: Hokkaido. Or the south, to Kyushu.
translation.es: Hokkaido. O al sur, a Kyushu.

translation.en: I just made some onigiri. Would you like some?
It was my mistake to move in here.
Don't say that. You've been so kind.
translation.es: - No digas eso. - Fuiste muy amable.

translation.en: She asked me if she could come in.

translation.es: - No fue tu culpa. - Sí, lo fue.

translation.en: There were others, too. My brother...
I can hardly walk up the stairs without seeing her face.
translation.es: No puedo subir las escaleras sin ver su rostro.

translation.en: I had waxed the steps two days before.
translation.es: Había encerado los escalones dos días antes.

translation.en: I only do it once every two years.
translation.es: Solo lo hago una vez cada dos años.

translation.en: I was worried they were a little slippery.
translation.es: Me preocupaba que estuvieran un poco resbalosos.

translation.en: I talked to Yamamoto- san earlier that day.
translation.es: Hablé con Yamamoto-san ese mismo día.

translation.en: But... I only remembered once I'd hung up.
would you say it was my fault?
